intro: Phyllanthus pancherianus var. memaoyaensis, commonly known as the Memaoyaensis Phyllanthus, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features include simple, opposite leaves and a distinctive fruit type known as a syncarp. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
